instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01987: What is 820-01987? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-01598: What is 820-01598? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Arrived with liquid damage on trackpad connector and a few capacitors. Pads 50-44 and 49-43 are completely gone on trackpad connector. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is shorted.

Only 3-4ohms resistance to ground on two of the large CPU coils.

What should be tried next? Using <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boardview as a reference, cant find <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boardview

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Probably the short is caused by trackpad connector, remove it.
Also compare resistance to ground with all big coils, just in case.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
short is still there after trackpad connector removed,

resistance to ground on big coils is different then <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> resistance to ground. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 1.8ohms. CPU  big coils 3.9ohms. All other big coils are much higher

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Then is safe to inject voltage.
Start with low voltage as 1V, and increase maintaining the current under amp limit.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Injected voltage and only area that gets warm is the trackpad area. Did some scrapping but short still remains.

Does This look like a hopeless repair?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Probably short between copper layers.
Use fiberglass pen to clean that area.
